nodes.bodyText: @genryxy test method name is not informative, please elaborate what's being tested here

@genryxy there is even better way to verify JSON using wtf.g4s8.hamcrest.json library, you can find usage example here https://github.com/artipie/nuget-adapter/blob/master/src/test/java/com/artipie/nuget/http/metadata/RegistrationPageTest.java
Using specialized matchers we do not enforce formatting and semantically identical JSON with different formatting will be considered equal.
@genryxy another example of JSON response matching: https://github.com/artipie/docker-adapter/blob/master/src/test/java/com/artipie/docker/http/IsErrorsResponse.java

@genryxy yeah, I see now that JsonContains lacks option to match the array ignoring order. Nothing to do about it now. Good thing is that order of keys is guaranteed by Storage.list method, so order is not likely to change
@genryxy creating matchers using constructors is preferred in this project over creation using static methods, so it will be better to use new AllOf<> here
@genryxy you are not using this library, so please remove the dependency
@genryxy it seems that this method is always used to create Content, so I think it might return Content and be renamed accordingly
